name: Butylated hydroxyanisole (BHA)
foods: Used in edible oils, chewing gum, fats, margarine, nuts, instant potato products, polyethylene food wraps.
notice: Not permitted in infant foods, allergic reaction, may trigger hyperactivity, concerns over carcinogenicity and estrogenic effects.
info: Petroleum derivative, retards spoilage due to oxidation; helps to prevent oxidations that cause oils and fats to become rancid.
